intro: Turnera dichotoma var. stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf turnera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
